alert.note: Alert for Denver (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 2:51PM MDT until further notice by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Cherry Creek in Denver County, between Cherry Creek State Park and downtown Denver. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain in the area of Cherry Creek Reservoir and upstream due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding along Cherry Creek towards downtown Denver. - Some locations that will experience flooding include...Cherry Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
